commit_message:
Validator chains now exit on the first error

Also, added some more robust error handling for buggy validators.
A broken validator will now cause Anchor to fail-closed and deny
a certificate, exactly as if that validator test had failed
normally.

A message is logged giving information about the error and a 500
is returned to the calling service with minimal information.

Change-Id: Iddbd0e831a52cc02cc569f220aebf82bd59554d0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/anchor refs/changes/13/177313/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from anchor import validators def test_check_broken_validator(self): data = {'user': 'myusername', 'secret': 'simplepassword', 'encoding': 'pem', 'csr': TestFunctional.csr_good} def derp(**kwdargs): raise Exception("BOOM") validators.broken_validator = derp jsonloader.conf.validators["default"]["broken_validator"] = {} resp = self.app.post('/sign', data, expect_errors=True) self.assertEqual(500, resp.status_int) self.assertTrue(("Internal Validation Error: BOOM running " "validator 'broken_validator' " "in set 'default'") in str(resp))

commit_message:
Updated repo server deps

This updates the deps that need to be on the repo server to ensure
that all of the python sources are built correctly. The additional
packages are in response to an upstream package dep
`python-qpid-proton` which is now requiring these items.

Change-Id: I6d6f70734fd46c4055f49fdf25035d2b4b212414
(cherry picked from commit 125b0d01b0dc0274fad120f6be0844bddccd0b89)

commit_message:
Set the log directory accordingly

This changes the log directory within the upstart init scripts
such that they are being set throughout the roles and removes an
assumed variable name as the name of the log directory.

Change-Id: I32a2a76a4a73b609999886427b494f380850f12a
Closes-Bug: #1460469
(cherry picked from commit 69d22e926cde40cd775d9bd4070a1d8e80991e64)

deleted_lines: logger.info('Wait a %s node offline status after unexpected ' 'reboot', nailgun_node.name) try: wait( lambda: not self.fuel_web.get_nailgun_node_by_devops_node(nailgun_node) ['online'], timeout=60 * 10) except TimeoutError: assert_false( self.fuel_web.get_nailgun_node_by_devops_node(nailgun_node) ['online'], 'Node {0} has not become offline after unexpected' 'reboot'.format(nailgun_node.name)) logger.info('Wait a %s node online status', nailgun_node.name)

of an argument that was passed in with one dash (-example).

commit_message:
Update rabbitmq package sha256 and remove group_vars rabbitmq_package_url

Commit 1bd2bc052a36c7f8c28e473d0a37fd29827198b0 implemented the package URL
update, but not the corresponding sha256 update. This patch corrects that.

This patch also removed the group_vars rabbitmq_package_url as it overrides
the role variable but does not have a corresponding sha256, causing a
download failure and confusion regarding the failure.

Change-Id: I3d7ac84c04c51af4a2861e23164758545de4850a
Closes-Bug: #1460992

commit_message:
fix ansible libary passing error arguments.

kolla is mandatory to run a version of docker-compose that 
includes pid: host support.docker-compose 1.3.0 to include the
necessary features.

docker-compose 1.3.0 project.up() abandoned the parameters 
detach and use allow_recreate replace recreate parameters.
closes-Bug: #1458116

Change-Id: I1235da58db5bedf208ebaea2a54568964dc802f8

commit_message:
Revert "Pass '--dhcp-authoritative' option to dnsmasq"

This reverts commit c3a88a578f3e484b5dc2a227a46e8546e581f8a3.
Due to an introduced a regression[1]:
In case where neutron was configured to have more than one DHCP agent per
network (dhcp_agents_per_network<=2), dnsmasq rejects leases of others
dnsmasq instances. Some clients do not check server-id for those NAKs,
failing to set an address.
The reverted commit originally came to fix the issue[2] with DHCPNAKs sent
after neutron-dhcp-agent restart. This issue is expected to be fixed by a
separate patch[3].
[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1457900
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1345947
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/185486
Related-Bug: 1457900
Related-Bug: 1345947

Change-Id: I45683d5201b066237af2debc9cdca91f6c0c6e1e

subject: VPNaaS: Fix breakage in status reporting
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-15 22:31:06.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_vpnaas/services/vpn/device_drivers/ipsec.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/commit/462a1165d8f347ff5afa08aa502436ee7d4dc9dd', 'message': 'VPNaaS: Fix breakage in status reporting

In the plugin, the status for the VPN service and its connections
are only updated if there is a change in the status or if the
pending_status_update flag is set. This flag is supposed to be
set when the status changes and the database has the resource in
PENDING_* state.

In the failure case, when the connection is created, the service
and connection are in PENDING_CREATE state in the plugin. In the
device driver, because of the create the service is set to ACTIVE
and its pending_status_update flag is set. The connection will be
in either DOWN or ACTIVE state and the pending_status_update_flag
is set. This is as expected.

When the device driver is about to report, it reads the latest
status and updates it, before reporting. This is where the bug
occurred.

Because of the recent change for translating the FQDN of peer to
IP address, if that fails, it attempts to set the status to ERROR
and force an update by setting updated_pending_status (so that it
updates, even if in pending state). However, the implementation
is set the updated_pending_status flag based on this "force" flag,
which is by default, false.

As a result, the flag gets cleared before the first report is sent
and the connection is never updated from then on (because it never
checks again to see if in PENDING_* state).

The fix is to simply only update the pending_status_update, when
the forced flag is set, otherwise leave it alone so that the flag
is not cleared on the first report.

In the future, this shoudl be reworked to a simpler mechanism that
just checks previous vs current status and reports any change, and
the plugin unconditionally updates the status.

Change-Id: Id49e54c49f3c72f676b6f2513288c0eae2c6db7b
Closes-Bug: #1440655
'}]
commit_message:
VPNaaS: Fix breakage in status reporting

In the plugin, the status for the VPN service and its connections
are only updated if there is a change in the status or if the
pending_status_update flag is set. This flag is supposed to be
set when the status changes and the database has the resource in
PENDING_* state.

In the failure case, when the connection is created, the service
and connection are in PENDING_CREATE state in the plugin. In the
device driver, because of the create the service is set to ACTIVE
and its pending_status_update flag is set. The connection will be
in either DOWN or ACTIVE state and the pending_status_update_flag
is set. This is as expected.

When the device driver is about to report, it reads the latest
status and updates it, before reporting. This is where the bug
occurred.

Because of the recent change for translating the FQDN of peer to
IP address, if that fails, it attempts to set the status to ERROR
and force an update by setting updated_pending_status (so that it
updates, even if in pending state). However, the implementation
is set the updated_pending_status flag based on this "force" flag,
which is by default, false.

As a result, the flag gets cleared before the first report is sent
and the connection is never updated from then on (because it never
checks again to see if in PENDING_* state).

The fix is to simply only update the pending_status_update, when
the forced flag is set, otherwise leave it alone so that the flag
is not cleared on the first report.

In the future, this shoudl be reworked to a simpler mechanism that
just checks previous vs current status and reports any change, and
the plugin unconditionally updates the status.

Change-Id: Id49e54c49f3c72f676b6f2513288c0eae2c6db7b
Closes-Bug: #1440655
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas refs/changes/24/183724/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: force_status_update=False): conn_info = self.connection_status.get(connection_id) if not conn_info: 'updated_pending_status': force_status_update conn_info['status'] = status if force_status_update: conn_info['updated_pending_status'] = True force_status_update=True)
deleted_lines: updated_pending_status=False): if not self.connection_status.get(connection_id): 'updated_pending_status': updated_pending_status self.connection_status[connection_id]['status'] = status self.connection_status[connection_id]['updated_pending_status'] = ( updated_pending_status) updated_pending_status=True)

commit_message:
Process port IP requests before subnet requests

When a port requests multiple fixed IPs, process the requests
for specific IP addresses before the ones asking for a subnet.
This prevents an error where the IP that was requested happens
to be the next up for allocation so the subnet request takes it
and causes a DBDuplicateEntry.

Closes-Bug: #1459467
Change-Id: I645565c7fe0c47c58d686b25020bb49a0b9089f5
(cherry picked from commit 817b45b6406d9730859535ac54d73ec5c85451d0)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/99/186599/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # we need to start with entries that asked for a specific IP in case # those IPs happen to be next in the line for allocation for ones that # didn't ask for a specific IP fixed_ips.sort(key=lambda x: 'ip_address' not in x)

subject: Persist DHCP leases to a local database
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-28 07:40:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/8d79966066072359e1cc442b78743dc892028bc1', 'message': "Persist DHCP leases to a local database

Due to issues caused by dnsmasq restarts sending DHCPNAKs,
change Ieff0236670c1403b5d79ad8e50d7574c1b694e34 passed the
'dhcp-authoritative' option to dnsmasq. While this solved the
restart issue, it broke the multi-DHCP server scenario because
the dnsmasq instances will NAK requests to a server ID that
isn't their own.

Problem DHCP Request Lifecycle:

Client: DHCPDISCOVER(broadcast)
Server1: DHCPOFFER
Server2: DHCPOFFER
Client: DHCPREQUEST(broadcast with Server-ID=Server1)
Server1: DHCPACK
Server2: DHCPNAK(in response to observed DHCPREQUEST with other Server-ID)
          ^---Causes issues

This change removes the authoritative option so NAKs are not
send in response to DHCPREQUEST's to other servers. To handle
the original issue that Ieff0236670c1403b5d79ad8e50d7574c1b694e34
was inteded to address, this patch also allows changes to be persisted
to a local lease file.

In order to handle the issue where a DHCP server may be scheduled
to another agent, a fake lease file is generated for dnsmasq to start
with. The contents are populated based on all of the known ports for
a network. This should prevent dnsmasq from NAKing clients renewing
leases issued before it was restarted/rescheduled.

Closes-Bug: #1457900
Change-Id: Idc91602bf8c474467e596cbd5cbaa8898952c841
(cherry picked from commit 4aba83fd22c8880a2d24f27e43a32cc164abe3e0)

a network. This should prevent dnsmasq from NAKing clients renewing

commit_message:
Persist DHCP leases to a local database

Due to issues caused by dnsmasq restarts sending DHCPNAKs,
change Ieff0236670c1403b5d79ad8e50d7574c1b694e34 passed the
'dhcp-authoritative' option to dnsmasq. While this solved the
restart issue, it broke the multi-DHCP server scenario because
the dnsmasq instances will NAK requests to a server ID that
isn't their own.

Problem DHCP Request Lifecycle:

Client: DHCPDISCOVER(broadcast)
Server1: DHCPOFFER
Server2: DHCPOFFER
Client: DHCPREQUEST(broadcast with Server-ID=Server1)
Server1: DHCPACK
Server2: DHCPNAK(in response to observed DHCPREQUEST with other Server-ID)
          ^---Causes issues

This change removes the authoritative option so NAKs are not
send in response to DHCPREQUEST's to other servers. To handle
the original issue that Ieff0236670c1403b5d79ad8e50d7574c1b694e34
was inteded to address, this patch also allows changes to be persisted
to a local lease file.

In order to handle the issue where a DHCP server may be scheduled
to another agent, a fake lease file is generated for dnsmasq to start
with. The contents are populated based on all of the known ports for
a network. This should prevent dnsmasq from NAKing clients renewing
leases issued before it was restarted/rescheduled.

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/unit/test_linux_dhcp.py - Subnet ID had to be added
    to the fake ports so they weren't skipped

Closes-Bug: #1457900
Change-Id: Idc91602bf8c474467e596cbd5cbaa8898952c841
(cherry picked from commit 4aba83fd22c8880a2d24f27e43a32cc164abe3e0)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/08/186308/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: '--dhcp-leasefile=/dhcp/%s/leases' % network.id] def _test_output_init_lease_file(self, timestamp): expected = [ '00:00:80:aa:bb:cc 192.168.0.2 * *', '00:00:f3:aa:bb:cc [fdca:3ba5:a17a:4ba3::2] * *', '00:00:0f:aa:bb:cc 192.168.0.3 * *', '00:00:0f:aa:bb:cc [fdca:3ba5:a17a:4ba3::3] * *', '00:00:0f:rr:rr:rr 192.168.0.1 * *\n'] expected = "\n".join(['%s %s' % (timestamp, l) for l in expected]) with mock.patch.object(dhcp.Dnsmasq, 'get_conf_file_name') as conf_fn: conf_fn.return_value = '/foo/leases' dm = dhcp.Dnsmasq(self.conf, FakeDualNetwork(), version=dhcp.Dnsmasq.MINIMUM_VERSION) dm._output_init_lease_file() self.safe.assert_called_once_with('/foo/leases', expected) @mock.patch('time.time') def test_output_init_lease_file(self, tmock): self.conf.set_override('dhcp_lease_duration', 500) tmock.return_value = 1000000 # lease duration should be added to current time timestamp = 1000000 + 500 self._test_output_init_lease_file(timestamp) def test_output_init_lease_file_infinite_duration(self): self.conf.set_override('dhcp_lease_duration', -1) # when duration is infinite, lease db timestamp should be 0 timestamp = 0 self._test_output_init_lease_file(timestamp)

commit_message:
Change external resources to https where possible

This change updates all of the external URLs to use HTTPS where
possible. the change will create a more secure deployment by default.

Change-Id: I4d53c021904208bffb0d597c7ae53bbd00f40209
Closes-Bug: 1411331

commit_message:
ipv6 compatibility issue, make sure we do not handle in the controller
any subnet that is not ipv4, ipv6 is offloaded to the Normal path
Add a casting call function for add_flow_normal_local_subnet and add a
inner check for ipv4, this was needed because we access the code before
calling the inner func

Change-Id: I0024b6f5da8a775dbd70d3ca7dfcbf98a63101e1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/74/187474/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self._add_flow_normal_local_subnet_cast( subnet) def _add_flow_normal_local_subnet_cast(self, priority, subnet): if not subnet.is_ipv4(): LOG.info(_LI("No support for IPV6")) return cidr = subnet.cidr for dp in self.dp_list.values(): self.add_flow_normal_local_subnet( dp.datapath, self.CLASSIFIER_TABLE, priority, cidr.network.format(), str(cidr.prefixlen), subnet.segmentation_id)
deleted_lines: cidr = subnet.cidr for dp in self.dp_list.values(): self.add_flow_normal_local_subnet( dp.datapath, self.CLASSIFIER_TABLE, cidr.network.format(), str(cidr.prefixlen), subnet.segmentation_id)

commit_message:
Exception was raised for ipv6 subnet for not having segmentation id,
We currently should not handle IPV6
First check if it is an ipv4 subnet if not do no handle

commit_message:
Add skipped test for bug 1412436

Add a test for a race between instance_create and
security_group_destroy. The test currently fails, so it is skipped.

Change-Id: I8fbddf53ba6475bcd31bf5aa439cd5fe3a1b48b7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/73/148273/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @test.testtools.skip("bug 1412436") def test_instance_create_security_group_destroy_race(self): '''Test a race between adding a security group to an instance, and deleting the security group. It could happen that a security group is returned by _security_group_get_by_names, but is deleted before being being added to the instance. The result should be the same as either: * Create instance, then delete security group: Instance, SecurityGroupInstanceAssociation and SecurityGroup all exist. SecurityGroupInstanceAssociation and SecurityGroup are both marked deleted. * Delete security group, then create instance: An error is raised due to the missing security group. Currently neither of the above is true. The result is that Instane, SecurityGroupInstanceAssociation and SecurityGroup all exist, but only SecurityGroup is marked as deleted. This test arbitrarily chooses to assert the latter, but can be modified to assert the former if that is the resolution of the above bug. ''' # Create then destroy a security group sg = db.security_group_create(self.ctxt, {'name': 'delete_me'}) db.security_group_destroy(self.ctxt, sg.id) # Create a fake sg_get_by_names which will return our deleted security # group. This replicates the race we are testing. orig_sg_get_by_names = sqlalchemy_api._security_group_get_by_names delete_me_returned = [False] def mock_sg_get_by_names(context, session, project_id, names): if 'delete_me' in names: delete_me_returned[0] = True names = [x for x in names if x != 'delete_me'] if len(names) == 0: sgs = [] else: sgs = orig_sg_get_by_names(context, session, project_id, names) sgs.append(sg) return sgs else: return orig_sg_get_by_names(context, session, project_id, names) with mock.patch.object(sqlalchemy_api, '_security_group_get_by_names', mock_sg_get_by_names): self.assertRaises(exception.SecurityGroupNotFoundForProject, db.instance_create, self.ctxt, {'security_groups': ['default', 'delete_me']}) # The test is only valid if we returned the deleted security group. self.assertTrue(delete_me_returned[0])

subject: Cleanup db.security_group_ensure_default()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-21 16:28:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/747b76f57f2143d156c0f328511c6fda8074353c', 'message': "Fix the principal race in db.security_group_ensure_default()

The code checked for the existence of the group, and if it didn't
exist it expected that creation would succeed. A failure was handled
by any code calling security_group_ensure_default(), which would catch
the exception and try to fetch the group a second time. However, it
wasn't handled by instance_create(), which would fail in this
situation.

This change handles the race by explicitly relying on the atomicity of
group creation. We also retry more than once, but bound the retries to
prevent a livelock.

The race condition test is updated accordingly. We also add a new test
for the livelock situation.

The function also contains a race in how it updates quota. This is a
larger, more general problem to be handled separately.

Change-Id: I08bcd0329b81bec63983631067d2b9cc0e8f6df3
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-01-16 13:45:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/2f002a0474bf1b2892b2dc2e934bb8ba816b20f1', 'message': "Fix the principal race in db.security_group_ensure_default()

The code checked for the existence of the group, and if it didn't
exist it expected that creation would succeed. A failure was handled
by any code calling security_group_ensure_default(), which would catch
the exception and try to fetch the group a second time. However, it
wasn't handled by instance_create(), which would fail in this
situation.

This change handles the race by explicitly relying on the atomicity of
group creation. We also retry more than once, but bound the retries to
prevent a livelock.

The race condition test is updated accordingly. We also add a new test
for the livelock situation.

The function also contains a race in how it updates quota. This is a
larger, more general problem to be handled separately.

Change-Id: I08bcd0329b81bec63983631067d2b9cc0e8f6df3
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2015-01-19 14:45:07.000000000', 'files': ['nova/exception.py', 'nova/tests/unit/db/test_db_api.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/40c314b2df3bac3e4a836e2ca0fff1f85f7c9bf2', 'message': 'Cleanup db.security_group_ensure_default()

Rename _security_group_ensure_default() to
_security_group_get_default() to reflect its usage.
security_group_ensure_default() retains its name as its return value
is never used.

Combine race handling into _security_group_get_default() rather than
splitting it across 2 functions where it might be missed.

Wrap _security_group_create() in a nested transaction to ensure it can
fail in a race without aborting the whole transaction.

Consequently, remove the redundant call to
security_group_ensure_default in instance_create, resulting in 1 less
select during instance_create.

We also add a test that instance_create creates the default security
group if necessary, which was previously missing.

Change-Id: I08bcd0329b81bec63983631067d2b9cc0e8f6df3
'}]
commit_message:
Cleanup db.security_group_ensure_default()

Rename _security_group_ensure_default() to
_security_group_get_default() to reflect its usage.
security_group_ensure_default() retains its name as its return value
is never used.

Combine race handling into _security_group_get_default() rather than
splitting it across 2 functions where it might be missed.

Wrap _security_group_create() in a nested transaction to ensure it can
fail in a race without aborting the whole transaction.

Consequently, remove the redundant call to
security_group_ensure_default in instance_create, resulting in 1 less
select during instance_create.

We also add a test that instance_create creates the default security
group if necessary, which was previously missing.

Change-Id: I08bcd0329b81bec63983631067d2b9cc0e8f6df3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/09/136409/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return _security_group_ensure_default(context) # Don't let this run away in the unlikely event of livelock for retries in range(0, 3): # Optimistically try to return the existing one try: return _security_group_get_by_names(context, session, context.project_id, ['default'])[0] except exception.NotFound: pass # Didn't find one, so create one try: # This raises DBDuplicateEntry, which would rollback the # whole transaction, so create a savepoint first with session.begin_nested(): default_group = _security_group_create(context, values, session=session) break except exception.SecurityGroupExists: # We raced, and somebody else already created it. Go round # again. continue else: raise exception.SecurityGroupCannotCreateDefaultRule( project_id=context.project_id) # If we got here it's because we created a new security group # Create quota usage for auto created default security group usage = model_query(context, models.QuotaUsage, read_deleted="no", session=session).\ filter_by(project_id=context.project_id).\ filter_by(user_id=context.user_id).\ filter_by(resource='security_groups') if not usage.first(): _quota_usage_create(context.project_id, context.user_id, 'security_groups', 1, 0, None, session=session) else: usage.update({'in_use': int(usage.first().in_use) + 1}) default_rules = _security_group_rule_get_default_query(context, session=session).all() for default_rule in default_rules: # This is suboptimal, it should be programmatic to know # the values of the default_rule rule_values = {'protocol': default_rule.protocol, 'from_port': default_rule.from_port, 'to_port': default_rule.to_port, 'cidr': default_rule.cidr, 'parent_group_id': default_group.id, } _security_group_rule_create(context, rule_values, session=session)
deleted_lines: try: return _security_group_ensure_default(context) except exception.SecurityGroupExists: # NOTE(rpodolyaka): a concurrent transaction has succeeded first, # suppress the error and proceed return security_group_get_by_name(context, context.project_id, 'default') try: default_group = _security_group_get_by_names(context, session, context.project_id, ['default'])[0] except exception.NotFound: default_group = _security_group_create(context, values, session=session) usage = model_query(context, models.QuotaUsage, read_deleted="no", session=session).\ filter_by(project_id=context.project_id).\ filter_by(user_id=context.user_id).\ filter_by(resource='security_groups') # Create quota usage for auto created default security group if not usage.first(): _quota_usage_create(context.project_id, context.user_id, 'security_groups', 1, 0, None, session=session) else: usage.update({'in_use': int(usage.first().in_use) + 1}) default_rules = _security_group_rule_get_default_query(context, session=session).all() for default_rule in default_rules: # This is suboptimal, it should be programmatic to know # the values of the default_rule rule_values = {'protocol': default_rule.protocol, 'from_port': default_rule.from_port, 'to_port': default_rule.to_port, 'cidr': default_rule.cidr, 'parent_group_id': default_group.id, } _security_group_rule_create(context, rule_values, session=session)

commit_message:
drop support for alpha releases

We no longer use alpha releases, so drop the special handling from the
release script.

Change-Id: Iea679b63b6522f4f25953b91d7b42b13865131ef

commit_message:
Make get_last_tag work on OS X

I run the release tools directly on my laptop in order to have the
launchpad authentication work properly, and OS X uses a different
version of sed than Linux. This patch makes the extended regex stuff
work properly on both platforms.

Change-Id: Id417c7178044dc7d16a347716a73a790bd4cb6e8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/release-tools refs/changes/56/184356/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: typeset sed_regex="-r" typeset uname=$(uname) if [[ $uname == "Darwin" ]]; then sed_regex="-E" fi | sed $sed_regex 's/^.+tag: ([^ ]+)[,\)].+$/\1/g' \

commit_message:
Include HEAD SHA in unreleased log output

Include the SHA of the current HEAD commit on the branch being queried
so we can copy that value to build a script to release the versions
reported. This lets us produce a proposed list of releases, ask the PTLs
to verify them, and then release exactly what we discussed even if it is
a couple of days later and more patches have merged.

Change-Id: I0720b88fc2e8f36310f3b585ff8f89640a8f8b39

commit_message:
Expose base check classes as part of public API

Those classes are used in neutron to implement custom attribute
and sub-attribute checks (get_network:attr:subattr syntax).
Those checks do not belong to oslo.policy since they would be
backwards incompatible with existing behaviour, introducing new
semantics and potentially breaking other projects, like nova.

So the alternative is to expose those symbols as part of public
API for the oslo library and allow other projects to reuse them.

More details on neutron issues consuming the library can be
found at:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-April/061783.html

Related-Bug: #1426082
Change-Id: I6ee9f8f7fcea3ddb2c52b5d58dfce3dd328c9131
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.policy refs/changes/83/176683/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class BaseCheckTypesTestCase(base.PolicyBaseTestCase): @mock.patch.object(_checks, 'registered_checks', {}) def test_base_check_types_are_public(self): for check_type in ('and', 'not', 'or', 'rule'): class TestCheck(getattr(policy, check_type.title() + 'Check')): pass policy.register(check_type, TestCheck) self.assertEqual(TestCheck, _checks.registered_checks[check_type])

commit_message:
This version contains the following pages:
 - Overview displays charts/reports (Currently only placeholders)
 - Configurations allows to define new backup configurations and link them to
   instances
 - Backups shows a list of all succesful backups and allows to restore them
 - Restores shows a history of all restored backups

It communicates with the api server via the client apis (freeezer.client.client).
The "glue code" between client apis and the UI lives in freezer.api.api.

Implements: Blueprint freezer-api-web-ui
Change-Id: I48cd8cba2b0169c6e64f650233c1a31b91ced34f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/freezer refs/changes/29/162129/24 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from horizon import tables from django.utils.translation import ugettext_lazy as _ from openstack_dashboard.dashboards.freezer.api import api as freezer_api from openstack_dashboard.dashboards.freezer.restores \ import tables as freezer_tables class IndexView(tables.DataTableView): name = _("Restores") slug = "restores" table_class = freezer_tables.RestoresTable template_name = ("freezer/restores/index.html") def has_more_data(self, table): return self._has_more def get_data(self): backups, self._has_more = freezer_api.get_all_restores(self.request) return backups

commit_message:
Use tar -t instead of -l because centos 6

Centos 6 tar appears to only support unix style tar args. Use tar -t
when we inspect test builds.

Change-Id: I91bf321cf6700d59956779a60f613eddd2856024

commit_message:
Ensure DIB_RELEASE is exported for fedora

This variable is useful for scripts to know what release they are
building.

Change-Id: Ib5f5d13a8f25f00fda07dad19aa1d603c1616a2e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/40/185840/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: export DIB_RELEASE=${DIB_RELEASE:-22}

commit_message:
Don't log tmpfs message during cleanup

By that point in the build it isn't generally useful, and it causes
confusion when builds fail because people think that's the error.

Change-Id: I26dee4ac0947b71a4a065ef6c5a18103e7df6667

The document about 'Rally with DevStack all-in-one installation'
shows that DevStack uses `localrc`, however DevStack uses `local.conf` now.

Change-Id: I8fc707b6d30b2ebbe2643f9eba0b01d8bda817cb
Closes-bug: 1460582

commit_message:
Fix document about Rally with DevStack all-in-one installation

The document about 'Rally with DevStack all-in-one installation'
shows that DevStack uses `localrc`, however DevStack uses `local.conf` now.
This patch fix (`localrc`->`local.conf`) the document.

Change-Id: I8fc707b6d30b2ebbe2643f9eba0b01d8bda817cb
Closes-bug: 1460582
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/58/187158/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cp samples/local.conf local.conf echo "enable_service rally" >> local.conf

subject: ansible libary passing error arguments detach and recreate to project.up().
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-02 09:37:34.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/library/docker_compose'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla/commit/958fb757d8c1cc710f828dc79787ef2652269c07', 'message': 'ansible libary passing error arguments detach and recreate to project.up().

kolla is mandatory to run a version of docker-compose that includes pid: host support.
docker-compose 1.3.0 to include the necessary features.

docker-compose 1.3.0 project.up() abandoned the parameters detach
use allow_recreate replace recreate parameters.
closes-Bug: #1458116

Change-Id: I88a6a0ef63f71ed7a66db538f2f8bf86586991f8
'}]
commit_message:
ansible libary passing error arguments detach and recreate to project.up().

kolla is mandatory to run a version of docker-compose that includes pid: host support.
docker-compose 1.3.0 to include the necessary features.

docker-compose 1.3.0 project.up() abandoned the parameters detach
use allow_recreate replace recreate parameters.
closes-Bug: #1458116

Change-Id: I88a6a0ef63f71ed7a66db538f2f8bf86586991f8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/05/187505/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: allow_recreate = not self.no_recreate,

Change-Id: I2882e19d49f2fb3471669f5eb8a017c5d5ac98c2

commit_message:
Catch exception trying to extract test time

The database I am getting back is a gdm database and it does
not have a get method.  Catch the exception and try something
else.  If that blows up, ignore because we'd rather see the
results of our tests.

Change-Id: I2882e19d49f2fb3471669f5eb8a017c5d5ac98c2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-testr refs/changes/00/187300/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: avg_runtime = float(test_times.get(str(test_id), False)) except Exception: try: avg_runtime = float(test_times[str(test_id)]) except Exception: avg_runtime = float(0.0)

commit_message:
API: Add policy enforcement test cases for pci API

in I0ad86604a31feafdb7500b0fdc27b76647c5fcf, we remove db layer admin
enforcement for compute_node_get_all and compute_node_search_by_hypervisor,
but get_by_compute_node is called by pci's index/detail.

This patch add policy enforcement test cases for pci's index/detail method,
together with show.

Partially implements bp nova-api-policy-final-part
Change-Id: I05e26fe8c61522a276d93ba6bbcece906d97de89

added_lines: class PciControllerPolicyEnforcementV21(test.NoDBTestCase): def setUp(self): super(PciControllerPolicyEnforcementV21, self).setUp() self.controller = pci.PciController() self.req = fakes.HTTPRequest.blank('') def _test_policy_failed(self, action, *args): rule_name = "os_compute_api:os-pci:%s" % action rule = {rule_name: "project:non_fake"} self.policy.set_rules(rule) exc = self.assertRaises( exception.PolicyNotAuthorized, getattr(self.controller, action), self.req, *args) self.assertEqual( "Policy doesn't allow %s to be performed." % rule_name, exc.format_message()) def test_index_policy_failed(self): self._test_policy_failed('index') def test_detail_policy_failed(self): self._test_policy_failed('detail') def test_show_policy_failed(self): self._test_policy_failed('show', 1)

commit_message:
Update bandit to use absolute imports

OpenStack follows the style of using absolute imports in all modules and
explicitly using the package name as well (i.e., avoiding relative
imports). This also aids with the work to add Python 3 compatibility.

Change-Id: Iae448af961e2b672a6de5000cc7a75d6c4668473

commit_message:
Fix --skip-identical to allow identical xLO to replace non-xLO

When --skip-identical option is used with an object upload, a
segmented xLO upload will currently not replace a regular object
with the same content. Similarly a non-segmented upload will not
replace an existing manifest pointing to segments that compose to
have the same content.

This patch makes --skip-identical option be ignored if the existing
object is a manifest and the upload is not, and vice-versa.

Plus drive-by fix to add account_username option to sample.conf for
funtional tests.

Change-Id: I90cfdef0d97a2aa16275d1cf69a6176ae12e6d2b

commit_message:
Handle exception when invalid config file is specified

When an invalid configuration file is specified (i.e. python
file), bandit prints a traceback. This change handles the
yaml parse exception and informs the user the configuration file
is invalid.

Change-Id: Id057c19ebddb16316c8b6e80cead51058a6172fd
Closes-bug: #1435422
